subject: Re: [junit] @BeforeClass throws NullPointerException
msgSnippet: ... I m not sure any tool should allow data to be shared across tests to be instance-level when that clearly runs counter to the notion that instances do not
messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
> On 9/29/05, Robert Watkins <yahoo@...> wrote:
> >
> >
> > Which is exactly why the @BeforeClass annotation needs to go on static
> > methods.
>
> Indeed, it's the unfortunate conclusion I reached as well.
>
> The fact remains that even JUnit users want to reuse data across methods.
> I'm not talking about dependencies, just about resources that are created at
> the beginning of the class and freed at the end.
>
> Test methods are not static, @BeforeClass methods are, so it forces you to
> put these resources in static fields.
>
> I sympathize with the effort of keeping test methods in isolation of each
> other, but if this state is read-only and that test methods are idempotent
> (can be run in any order), then this state is not really "evil" in terms of
> unit testing.
>
> It's too bad that JUnit3 (and JUnit4 it seems) will continue to ignore this
> need.

I'm not sure any tool should allow data to be shared across tests to be
instance-level when that clearly runs counter to the notion that
instances do not share instance-level data with other instances.

If you want to share data across instances, then it has to be
class-level. That's Java. Hell, that's OO.

Take care.
